metadata.title: CVE-2019-17005 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The plain text serializer used a fixed-size array for the number of <ol>elements it could process; however it was possible to overflow thestatic-sized array leading to memory corruption and a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.3, FirefoxESR < 68.3, and Firefox < 71.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17005` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
thunderbird package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
